place.name: HATTON
place.gazetteerText: HATTON, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; 3½ miles ESE of Wragby, and 7 NE by N of Bardney r. station. Post town, Wragby. Acres, 1,831. Real property, £1, 702. Pop., 199. Houses, 33. The manor belongs to the Sibthorpe family. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £227. Patrons, the Trustees of W. H. Sibthorpe, Esq. The church consists of nave and chancel, with a turret. Charities £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
